briefdescription.para: Adds the specified node to the end of the list of child nodes for this node.

detaileddescription.para: If the newChild is already in the tree, it is first removed.
If the node being inserted was created from another document, you should use ImportNode() to import the node to the current document. The imported node can then be inserted into the current document.

briefdescription.para: Gets all immediate child nodes of this node.

detaileddescription.para: Note, ChildNodes is equivalent to calling GetChildNodes(NodeType.Any, false) and creates and returns a new collection every time it is accessed.
If there are no child nodes, this property returns an empty collection.

briefdescription.para: Gets the number of immediate children of this node.
Gets the first child of the node.
Returns true if this node has any child nodes.
Returns true as this node can have child nodes.
Gets the last child of the node.
Returns an Nth child node that matches the specified type.

detaileddescription.para: If index is out of range, a null is returned.

briefdescription.para: Returns a live collection of child nodes that match the specified type.

detaileddescription.para: The collection of nodes returned by this method is always live.

A live collection is always in sync with the document. For example, if you selected all sections in a document and enumerate through the collection deleting the sections, the section is removed from the collection immediately when it is removed from the document.

briefdescription.para: Provides support for the for each style iteration over the child nodes of this node.
Gets the text of this node and of all its children.

detaileddescription.para: The returned string includes all control and special characters as described in ControlChar.

briefdescription.para: Returns the index of the specified child node in the child node array.
Inserts the specified node immediately after the specified reference node.

detaileddescription.para: If refChild is null, inserts newChild at the beginning of the list of child nodes.
If the newChild is already in the tree, it is first removed.
If the node being inserted was created from another document, you should use ImportNode() to import the node to the current document. The imported node can then be inserted into the current document.

briefdescription.para: Inserts the specified node immediately before the specified reference node.

detaileddescription.para: If refChild is null, inserts newChild at the end of the list of child nodes.
If the newChild is already in the tree, it is first removed.
If the node being inserted was created from another document, you should use ImportNode() to import the node to the current document. The imported node can then be inserted into the current document.

briefdescription.para: Adds the specified node to the beginning of the list of child nodes for this node.

detaileddescription.para: If the newChild is already in the tree, it is first removed.
If the node being inserted was created from another document, you should use ImportNode() to import the node to the current document. The imported node can then be inserted into the current document.

briefdescription.para: Removes all the child nodes of the current node.
Removes the specified child node.

detaileddescription.para: The parent of oldChild is set to null after the node is removed.

briefdescription.para: Removes all SmartTag descendant nodes of the current node.
Selects a list of nodes matching the XPath expression.

detaileddescription.para: Only expressions with element names are supported at the moment. Expressions that use attribute names are not supported.

simplesect.para: A list of nodes matching the XPath query.

briefdescription.para: Selects the first Node that matches the XPath expression.

detaileddescription.para: Only expressions with element names are supported at the moment. Expressions that use attribute names are not supported.

simplesect.para: The first Node that matches the XPath query or null if no matching node is found.

briefdescription.para: Base class for nodes that can contain other nodes.

detaileddescription.para: A document is represented as a tree of nodes, similar to DOM or XmlDocument.
For more info see the Composite design pattern.
The CompositeNode class:

listitem.para: Provides access to the child nodes.
Implements Composite operations such as insert and remove children.
